channel.title: Php Form
channel.description:
Was wondering if anyone had a php script for a form to have an option to put a image url into a box then it would email me or it could go into another php or html file all I got was this.. form.html [code]

Header

Image Url:
[/code] process.php [code] "; echo "Thank you for submitting an image url!"; ?> [/code] But then it wont save it anywhere?

item.title: Php Form
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

config.php
[php]

<? //Advanced Uploader V1.00b //Copyright 2002 ZachWhite.com //By using this program you agree with the license provide with it. //Script by Zach White http://www.zachwhite.com zachwhite@zachwhite.com $absolute_path = "/web/zach/uploads"; //Absolute path to where files are uploaded $size_limit = "no"; //do you want a size limit yes or no. $limit_size = "20000000"; //How big do you want size limit to be in bytes $limit_ext = "no"; //do you want to limit the extensions of files uploaded $ext_count = "4"; //total number of extensions in array below $extensions = array(".gif", ".jpg", ".jpeg", ".png"); //List extensions you want files uploaded to be ?>

[/php]
Upload.php

[php]

<? //Advanced Uploader V1.00b //Copyright 2002 ZachWhite.com //By using this program you agree with the license provide with it. //Script by Zach White http://www.zachwhite.com zachwhite@zachwhite.com if(!isset($upload)) { $upload = ""; } switch($upload) { default: include "config.php"; echo " Upload

Upload File
The following restrictions apply:
  • File extension must be "; if (($extensions == "") or ($extensions == " ") or ($ext_count == "0") or ($ext_count == "") or ($limit_ext != "yes") or ($limit_ext == "")) { echo "any extension"; } else { $ext_count2 = $ext_count+1; for($counter=0; $counter<$ext_count; $counter++) { echo "  $extensions[$counter]"; } } if (($limit_size == "") or ($size_limit != "yes")) { $limit_size = "any size"; } else { $limit_size .= " bytes"; } echo"
  • Maximum file size is $limit_size
  • No spaces in the filename
  • Filename cannot contain illegal characters (/,*,\,etc)



Upload

"; break; case "doupload": include "config.php"; $endresult = "File Was Uploaded"; if ($file_name == "") { $endresult = "No file selected"; }else{ if(file_exists("$absolute_path/$file_name")) { $endresult = "File Already Existed"; } else { if (($size_limit == "yes") && ($limit_size < $file_size)) { $endresult = "File was to big"; } else { $ext = strrchr($file_name,'.'); if (($limit_ext == "yes") && (!in_array($ext,$extensions))) { $endresult = "File is wrong type"; }else{ @copy($file, "$absolute_path/$file_name") or $endresult = "Couldn't Copy File To Server"; } } } } echo " Upload

Upload File
$endresult

"; break; } ?>

[/php]

item.title: Php Form
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

Was wondering if anyone had a php script for a form to have an option to put a image url into a box then it would email me or it could go into another php or html file all I got was this…
form.html

<html><body>
<h4>Header</h4>
<form> 
<select> 
<option>option1</option>
<option>option2</option>
<option>option3</option>
</select>
Image Url: <input type="text" /> 
<input type="submit" />
</form>
</body></html>

process.php

<html><body>
<?php
$imageurl = $_POST['image url'];
$item = $_POST['item'];

echo "You submitted a image url ". $quantity . " " . $item . ".<br />";
echo "Thank you for submitting an image url!";

?>
</body></html>

But then it wont save it anywhere?

Read full topic
